lines.text: [first lines]
Ah, my dear Ann! So glad to see you again after all these minutes. Twenty of them, at least.
*Fifty* minutes, Johnny.
Fifty minutes! Fifty years away from you, Ann.
You're not flattering me Johnny. Now what have you been doing?
Waiting for the specimen at Dr. Lees'.
I could check with Dr. Lees' office nurse, you know... but I'll let it go at that.
Ah, gee, thanks Ann. Dr. Lee would like to have reports quickly as possible.
I don't think we can run another test this afternoon, Johnny.
Well, that's OK with me. But if the boss wouldn't spend so much time experimenting with those rabbits, he'd get down to his own...
That's Mr. Stendahl's business, Johnny. And if you wouldn't spend so much time running errands... Deliver this to Dr. Jackson.
OK, Ann.
[last lines]
You Don Young?
Yes, sir? What's this for?
Don't know, Harrigan's orders.
Why do you always find it necessary to kill every time I send you for something?
Well, he come in and switched on the lights.
Oh, I see.
Moloch is a true scientist. He understands the unimportance of a mere life when it might impede progress.
It was dead. Now it lives. We've made a successful beginning at last!
No offense, but with that face you're not exactly a Casanova, you know.
